column1: Ząbkowice Śląskie (Zombkovitze [zɔmpkɔˈvit͡sɛ ˈɕlɔ̃skʲɛ]; German: Frankenstein in Schlesien) is a town in Lower Silesian Voivodeship in south-western Poland. It is the seat of Ząbkowice Śląskie County and of Gmina Ząbkowice Śląskie.
The town lies approximately 63 kilometres (39 miles) south of the regional capital Wrocław. As of 2019
The town was established by Duke of Silesia Henry IV Probus
